title: Fundamentals of Theory
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of theory. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Fundamentals of Applications
description: Interdisciplinary approach to applications combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Intermediate Methods
description: Comprehensive study of methods with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Applied Workshop
description: Comprehensive study of workshop with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Workshop
description: In-depth analysis of workshop principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Advanced Workshop
description: In-depth analysis of workshop principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Applications
description: Advanced exploration of applications covering current research and industry practices.

title: Advanced Seminar
description: Comprehensive study of seminar with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: EDUC 368 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Research
description: Interdisciplinary approach to research combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: EDUC 346 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Theory
description: Interdisciplinary approach to theory combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: EDUC 382 and senior standing or graduate status
